sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the S&P 500 index, there is noteworthy activity today in Home Depot Inc (Symbol: HD), where a total volume of 21,830 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 2.2 million underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 50.3% of HD's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 4.3 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $155 strike call option expiring July 21, 2017 , with 1,241 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 124,100 underlying shares of HD.

Below is a chart showing HD's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $155 strike highlighted in orange:

Morgan Stanley (Symbol: MS) options are showing a volume of 38,861 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 3.9 million underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 44.5% of MS's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 8.7 million shares.

Especially high volume was seen for the $37 strike put option expiring July 07, 2017 , with 7,514 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 751,400 underlying shares of MS. Below is a chart showing MS's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $37 strike highlighted in orange:

And Boeing Co. (Symbol: BA) saw options trading volume of 12,945 contracts, representing approximately 1.3 million underlying shares or approximately 43.4% of BA's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 3.0 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $192.50 strike put option expiring July 21, 2017 , with 1,029 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 102,900 underlying shares of BA.

Below is a chart showing BA's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $192.50 strike highlighted in orange:
